------=_NextPart_000_003E_01C1C632.29754420
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

He slowly starts to move again. The legendary Autobot, who had descided to =
work on a Maximal ship, made his way to the bridge.

{Talos}
Bridge

The ma=
ximal commander listened as the reports came in, the armory he imagined mus=
t have looked like a battle hit it. Sighing he righted himself in his chair=
 more fully turning towards the two bots that had walked onto his bridge gi=
ving a nod of respect to Hot Rod, it had been a relative honor to serve alo=
ngside one of the more key figures in their peoples histories.

The other s=
eemed to imply he was a criminal of some sort, he didn't really care in any=
 case. "Armory is only shook up, but reports seem to say the thrusters are =
off line and quite frankly scrap. We need to get external sensors up and se=
e just what kind of planet we've crashed ourselves on, once we can see wher=
e the slag we are we can go from there..."

Turning he regarded the 'crimin=
al', "I don't know what in the Matrix you're talking about. You appear to b=
elieve you're in trouble with the law but at this point I don't give a slag=
 what you've done. This ship is in bad shape, we have a mission to complete=
 and I don't have time to assign personnel to guard you in a brig."

    Tu=
rning he looked the bot in the eye, "Help Hot Rod get our sensors up and ru=
nning or report yourself to the CR chambers on deck two if you're too injur=
ed to help. But if you plan on sticking around you're gonna help us, now ge=
t to it."

    Swiveling in the chair he regarded the com, "Icedemon and Ar=
changel get started on repairs on either the computers or Comm systems. Bla=
ckKnight check the ship for any more bots whose comms might be down, injuri=
es to the CR chambers those not functioning, as much as I hate to say it, w=
e'll worry about later, priority on the operational first."

Turning back t=
o look out the shattered window he silently hoped Megatron was as bad off a=
s they were, if the predicons launched a pre-emptive strike he doubted the =
ship could take a beating after the crash. Moving to the computers he began=
 investigating the status of the frigates weapons and defense systems, they=
 weren't priority one at the moment but he wanted at least something to re-=
assure the crew they weren't sitting blind and utterly defenseless.
